Description.Name: River Hawk
Description.Details: The River Hawk is arguably the greatest failure ever produced by the RAD Group, being originally built for the Star League in 2739 shortly after the Osprey was created, with many referring to it as a '100 ton Charger' thanks to the standard RH-A-SL's massive RADTech 400 standard fusion engine, which in combination with it's underwhelming weapons setup and a pathetic 10.5 tons of standard armor quickly led to the mech suffering the same fate as the Charger it is often likened to during the Star League era, and also like the Charger, would be saved as a desperate and shattered RAD Group found the production line for the chassis was one of the few left functioning and would manage to sell these machines to the Great Houses during the Succession Wars despite it's flaws, meaning the chassis can be found semi-frequently throughout the Inner Sphere. The RH-A-LC was a refit originally originating in the Lyran Commonwealth and was based around the then new Large Binary Laser, supplanting it with a trio of Medium Lasers and a Flamer. The 15 heat sinks are often outmatched with this setup, and while the mech gets 2 additional tons of armor, it remains brittle in comparison to other machines it's size.
